quotes.quote: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.
Kind words are a creative force, a power that concurs in the building up of all that is good, and energy that showers blessings upon the world.
Kind words not only lift our spirits in the moment they are given, but they can linger with us over the years.
Kind words produce happiness. How often have we ourselves been made happy by kind words, in a manner and to an extent which we are unable to explain!
The kindest word in all the world is the unkind word, unsaid.
One kind word can warm three winter months.
Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
Be an encourager. Scatter sunshine. Who knows whose life you might touch with something as simple as a kind word.
Wise sayings often fall on barren ground, but a kind word is never thrown away.
If we must part forever, Give me but one kind word to think upon, And please myself with, while my heart's breaking.
Modern science is still trying to produce a tranquilizer more effective than a few kind words.
Let a kind word warm you when your thoughts turn cold.
Kind words are salve to a cankered soul; spread generously.
Kind words are such a blessing to the needful, if one but knew the pleasure that they bring.
Until you have cultivated the habit of saying some kind word of those whom you do not admire, you will be neither successful nor happy.
They say, You can't give a smile away; it always comes back. The same is true of a kind word or a conversation starter. What goes around, comes around.
Sometimes all it takes is a kind word of encouragement to get your heroes back on the right path.
Be kind to everyone - you don't know what cross they're bearing and how sweet that kind word might ring.
Kind words produce their images on men's souls.
A kind word is like a Spring day.
A kind word will give more pleasure than a present.
Never lose a chance of saying a kind word
Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.

You have it easily in your power to increase the sum total of this world's happiness now. How? By giving a few words of sincere appreciation to someone who is lonely or discouraged. Perhaps you will forget tomorrow the kind words you say today, but the recipient may cherish them over a lifetime.
Kind hearts are the gardens, Kind thoughts are the roots, Kind words are the blossoms, Kind deeds are the fruits.

A couple of kind words can not only make a person's day, but earn you a friend and supporter for life. For the rest of the week, whenever you see someone you want to judge negatively, pay them a compliment instead. See what happens.
Give a kind word (with a kindly thought behind the word) — you will be kind and receive kind words.
Be nice to people whether you mean it or not. You never know when a kind word can make a difference in another person’s day – or maybe even his or her life.
Every day, tell at least one person something you like, admire, or appreciate about them.
Your words have power. Speak words that are kind, loving, positive, uplifting, encouraging, and life-giving.
